chargeHist.descr: Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Discharge Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornelia Muzzet Britton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cornelia Muzzet Britton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Cornelia Muzzet Britton was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cornelia Muzzet Britton is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Cornelia Muzzet Britton was found guilty of Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Discharge Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cornelia Muzzet Britton in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Corrections with huber release for work and medical appointments, with credit for 6 days time served.  
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 YEAR.  
Court orders the following conditions of probation:  
*No weapons;
*No contact with victim, Christopher D.;
*Maintain absolute sobriety;
*No new offenses.

Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders those amounts payable during the period of probation.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant of her right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief.

Defendant Cornelia Muzzet Britton in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for Zachary Wittchow for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
Matter scheduled for Sentencing Hearing. State is unable to proceed to sentencing as engaged in trial in another court. State requests adjournment. Court authorizes adjournment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cornelia Muzzet Britton in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the hour of 10:25am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of NOT GUILTY (as to COUNT 1) and GUILTY (as to COUNT 2) which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted defense motion for judgment of aquittal as to COUNT 1.  Court ordered entry of judgment of aquittal as to COUNT 1.  Court granted the state's motion for judgment on the verdict as to COUNT 2 and denied defense motion to withhold judgment.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to COUNT 2.  Matter scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

(AM) Defendant Cornelia Muzzet Britton in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears in Court late, Court admonishes defendant.  Jury in box at 9:03am.  Trial continues.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Jeffrey Emanuelson, MPD Officer Matthew Terpstra, MPD Officer Paul Graczyk.  Jury out of box for break.  Jury in box.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer John Kohler.  Exhibits 1-7 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Detrica J.  Jury out of box.  Court holds colloquy with defendant re: right to testify.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Jury in box.  Sworn for defense: defendant.  Court released jury for the lunch hour at 11:57am.  Trial to continue at 1:30pm.  

(PM) Same appearances.  Sworn testimony of defendant continues.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Jeffery Emanuelson.  Exhibit 8 received.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Instruction conference held.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror (#7) selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:37pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Karweik and Walls who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Defense motion to dismiss at the close of the State's case argued and denied by the Court.  Parties stipulate to exhibits 1, 3-5 and 8 being released to the jury if requested.  Jury in box at 4:52pm.  Court releases jury for the evening.  Deliberations to continue on 2/10/17 at 8:30am.
- (2) ASL

Same appearances.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers.  Court makes record re: possible testimony of State witness.  Jury panel in Court at 1:54pm.  Also present in Court: Sign Language Interpreters (for juror 23): Maria Kielma, Timothy Mumm (previously sworn).  Voir dire continues.  Panel out of court for break.  Court conducts individual voir dire of juror 13.  Juror 13 out of court for break.  Strikes for cause placed on the record.  State's witness: Christopher D. in court.  Court advises witness of his rights re: self incrimination.  Court conducts individual voir dire of juror 4.  Juror 4 out of court for break.  Based upon the stipulation of the parties, Court orders Party to a Crime designation as to COUNT 2 removed.  Panel in court.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Christopher D.  Jury is released for the evening at 4:53pm.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Trial to continue on 2/9/17 at 8:30am.

Defendant Cornelia Muzzet Britton in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial today.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Matter is called on the record.  On motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 3 DISMISSSED.  Trial to proceed as to COUNTS 1 and 2 ONLY.  State's resolution offer is placed on the record and denied by defendant.  Court hears argument from defendant re: her current representation.  Court holds colloquy with defendant.  For reasons as set forth, Court will proceed to trial today as scheduled.  Trial rules and procedures placed on the record.  Court makes witness exclusion order.  Jury panel in court.  Sign Language Interpreters Sworn (for juror 23): Maria Kielma, Timothy Mumm.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:45am.  Jury panel is released for the lunch hour at 11:53am, jury selection to resume at 1:30pm.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  In conference chambers (off the record) held with counsels prior to case being called on the record.  Case called on the record.  State is ready to proceed, defense is not; issues set forth on the record.   

Defense motion to adjourn argued. Argument made by the state and defense as to filing of amended information.  The Court to allow amended information.   Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the amended information.  Defendant requests reading.  The Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  The Court makes inquiry of defendant as position regarding defense.  After brief discussion the defendant is willing to continue with defense counsel at this time.  Defense motion to adjourn granted by the court; adjourned date selected.  Defense indicates possible motion forthcoming.  The Court instructs defense to file any motion(s) at least 30 days prior to jury trial date.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Cornelia Muzzet Britton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Cornelia Muzzet Britton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
